snippet: To reach the multitude of online services competing for your attention, you must first get through a bottleneck that is not competitive at all: high-speed broadband access.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column notes that the dispute between Comcast and Netflix on broadband data access underscores the core weakness of the Internet economy; notes that 96 percent of Americans have a choice of only two broadband providers--at most--a situation that leads to higher cost and less innovation.
lead_paragraph: To reach the multitude of online services competing for your attention, you must first get through a bottleneck that is not competitive at all: high-speed broadband access.

headline.seo: Net Neutrality and Economic Equality Are Intertwined
